00024 #include <rdkcore/logging/logging.h>
00025 #define LOGGING_MODULE "ModuleManager"

00030 //#define DOUT(x, args...) RDK_DEBUG_PRINTF(a, ##args)
00031 #define DOUT(x, args...)

00033 namespace RDK2 { namespace RAgent {
00034 
00035 ModuleManager::ModuleManager(Repository* repository, bool isRConsole) : 
00036     repository(repository), isRConsole(isRConsole) { }
00037 
00038 bool ModuleManager::instantiateModules(const ModuleConfigVector& ml) {
00039     for (ModuleConfigVector::const_iterator i = ml.begin(); i != ml.end(); ++i) {
00040         if (!isRConsole) {
00041             if ((*i)->library.substr(0, 9) == "librdk2rc") continue;
00042             if ((*i)->library.substr(0, 10) == "librdk2gui") continue;
00043         }
00044         if (!instantiateModule(*(*i))) return false;
00045     }
00046     return true;
00047 }
00048 
00049 Module* ModuleManager::instantiateModule(const ModuleConfig& cm)
00050 {
00051     DOUT("Instantiating '%s' from '%s'", cm.moduleName.c_str(), cm.library.c_str());
00052     Module* module = Module::createFromLibrary(cm.library);
00053     if (!module) {
00054         RDK_ERROR_PRINTF("Error in module creation (library '%s')", cm.library.c_str());
00055         RDK_ERROR_PRINTF("Make sure you set the library path (i.e. . setenv) "
00056             "and the name of the library is correct");
00057         return 0;
00058     }
00059     module->setModuleManager(this);
00060 
00061     Session *session = repository->createSession(cm.moduleName,
00062         "Session for " + cm.moduleName + " module", "/" + cm.moduleName);
00063     module->setSession(session);
00064 
00065     Session *qtSession = repository->createSession(cm.moduleName + "_QT",
00066         "QT session for " + cm.moduleName + " module", "/" + cm.moduleName);
00067     module->setQtSession(qtSession);
00068 
00069     Session *asyncSession = repository->createSession(cm.moduleName + "_Async",
00070         "Async session for " + cm.moduleName + " module", "/" + cm.moduleName);
00071     module->setAsyncSession(asyncSession);
00072     
00073     if (!module->initConfigurationProperties()) {
00074         RDK_ERROR_PRINTF("Error in module '%s' configuration properties creation", cm.moduleName.c_str());
00075         return 0;
00076     }
00077     module->initWithModuleConfig(cm);
00078 
00079     if (!module->initInterfaceProperties()) {
00080         RDK_ERROR_PRINTF("Error in module '%s' configuration properties creation", cm.moduleName.c_str());
00081         return 0;
00082     }
00083     module->initWithModuleConfig(cm, true);
00084     
00085     addModule(module);
00086     return module;
00087 }
00088 
00089 bool ModuleManager::instantiateAdditionalModule(const ModuleConfig& cm, bool alsoStart)
00090 {
00091     Module * module = instantiateModule(cm);
00092     if(!module) {
00093         RDK_ERROR_STREAM("Could not instantiate new module");
00094         return false;
00095     }
00096 
00097     if (!module->initInterfaceProperties()) {
00098         RDK_ERROR_STREAM("Could not initInterfaceProperties new module");
00099         return false;
00100     }
00101     module->initWithModuleConfig(cm);
00102     
00103     if (alsoStart) {
00104         if (!module->init()) {
00105             RDK_ERROR_STREAM("Could not init new module");
00106             return false;
00107         }
00108         initializedModules.push_back(module);
00109         module->start();
00110     }
00111     
00112     return true;
00113 }
00114 
00115 // add a module in the list, the semaphore is the one where the timer signals
00116 void ModuleManager::addModule(Module* module)
00117 {
00118     moduleListMutex.lock(HERE);
00119     modules.push_back(module);
00120     moduleListMutex.unlock();
00121 }
00122 
00123 // call init() of every module
00124 bool ModuleManager::initAllModules()
00125 {
00126     RDK_INFO_STREAM("Initializing (init()) all modules...");
00127     moduleListMutex.lock(HERE);
00128     for (list<Module*>::iterator it = modules.begin(); it != modules.end(); ++it) {
00129         DOUT("Initializing module '%s'", (*it)->getModuleName().c_str());
00130         if(!(*it)->init()) {
00131             RDK_ERROR_STREAM("Could not init module " << (*it)->getModuleName());
00132             RDK_ERROR_STREAM("Aborting initialization");
00133             return false;
00134         }
00135         initializedModules.push_back(*it);
00136     }
00137     moduleListMutex.unlock();
00138     RDK_INFO_STREAM("All modules initialized.");
00139     return true;
00140 }
00141 
00142 // instantiate a thread for each exec() of each module
00143 void ModuleManager::startAllModules()
00144 {
00145     RDK_INFO_STREAM("Starting all modules threads...");
00146     moduleListMutex.lock(HERE);
00147     for (list<Module*>::iterator it = modules.begin(); it != modules.end(); ++it) {
00148         DOUT("Starting module '%s'", (*it)->getModuleName().c_str());
00149         (*it)->start();
00150     }
00151     moduleListMutex.unlock();
00152     RDK_INFO_STREAM("All modules threads started.");
00153 }
00154 
00155 ModuleConfigVector ModuleManager::getModuleConfigs()
00156 {
00157     ModuleConfigVector ml;
00158     moduleListMutex.lock(HERE);
00159     for (list<Module*>::iterator it = modules.begin(); it != modules.end(); ++it) {
00160         ml.push_back((ModuleConfig*) (*it)->createModuleConfig().clone());
00161     }
00162     moduleListMutex.unlock();
00163     return ml;
00164 }
00165 
00166 bool ModuleManager::requestExitForModule(cstr instanceName)
00167 {
00168     for (list<Module*>::iterator it = modules.begin(); it != modules.end(); ++it) {
00169         if ((*it)->getModuleName() == instanceName) {
00170             DOUT("Requesting exit for module '%s'", instanceName.c_str());
00171             (*it)->requestExit();
00172             DOUT("Requested exit for module '%s'", instanceName.c_str());
00173             return true;
00174         }
00175     }
00176     return false;
00177 }
00178 
00179 bool ModuleManager::deleteModule(cstr instanceName)
00180 {
00181     //moduleListMutex.lock(HERE);   // FIXME
00182     for (list<Module*>::iterator it = modules.begin(); it != modules.end(); ++it) {
00183         if ((*it)->getModuleName() == instanceName) {
00184             DOUT("Requesting exit for module '%s'", instanceName.c_str());
00185             (*it)->requestExit();
00186             DOUT("Waiting for module '%s' to exit", (*it)->getModuleName().c_str());
00187             if ((*it)->threadId) pthread_join((*it)->threadId, 0);
00188             DOUT("Calling cleanup for module '%s'", (*it)->getModuleName().c_str());
00189             moduleSafeCleanup(*it);
00190             DOUT("Deleting session %x", (*it)->session);
00191             delete (*it)->session;
00192             DOUT("Deleting qtSession %x", (*it)->qtSession);
00193             delete (*it)->qtSession;
00194             DOUT("Deleting asyncSession %x", (*it)->asyncSession);
00195             delete (*it)->asyncSession;
00196             delete (*it);
00197             modules.erase(it);
00198             return true;
00199         }
00200     }
00201     //moduleListMutex.unlock();
00202     RDK_ERROR_PRINTF("Unknown module '%s'", instanceName.c_str());
00203     return false;
00204 }
00205 
00206 // signal something to the module (requestExit()) and wait for each exec() to exit, then call cleanup()
00207 void ModuleManager::endAllModules()
00208 {
00209     moduleListMutex.lock(HERE);
00210     for (list<Module*>::iterator it = modules.begin(); it != modules.end(); ++it) {
00211         DOUT("Requesting exit for module '%s'", (*it)->getModuleName().c_str());
00212         (*it)->requestExit();
00213     }
00214     moduleListMutex.unlock();
00215 
00216     moduleListMutex.lock(HERE);
00217     for (list<Module*>::iterator it = modules.begin(); it != modules.end(); ++it) {
00218         DOUT("Waiting for module '%s' to exit", (*it)->getModuleName().c_str());
00219         pthread_join((*it)->threadId, 0);
00220         DOUT("Module '%s' exited", (*it)->getModuleName().c_str());
00221     }
00222     moduleListMutex.unlock();
00223 }
00224 
00225 void ModuleManager::cleanupAllModules()
00226 {
00227     moduleListMutex.lock(HERE);
00228     for (list<Module*>::iterator it = modules.begin(); it != modules.end(); ++it) {
00229         DOUT("Calling cleanup for module '%s'", (*it)->getModuleName().c_str());
00230         moduleSafeCleanup(*it);
00231         delete (*it)->session;
00232         delete (*it)->qtSession;
00233         delete (*it)->asyncSession;
00234         delete (*it);
00235     }
00236     moduleListMutex.unlock();
00237 }
00238 
00239 void ModuleManager::moduleSafeCleanup(Module *module)
00240 {
00241     list<const Module*>::iterator it;
00242     bool found = false;
00243     // Find the module in our list
00244     for (it = initializedModules.begin(); 
00245          ((it != initializedModules.end()) && !found);
00246          it++) {
00247         if ((*it) == module) {
00248             found = true;
00249             module->cleanup();
00250         }
00251     }
00252     initializedModules.remove(module);          
00253 }
